str2: When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From the base of rhonnumi; strength; Roma, the capital of Italy.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.
To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular

str2: With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
str2: Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
